section_title: Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: Master Python's fundamental building blocks through hands-on coding exercises. Learn to create, manipulate, and convert variables while understanding type systems, memory allocation, and best practices for naming conventions.
learning_objectives: Create and assign variables using proper Python naming conventions
Demonstrate understanding of mutable vs immutable data types
Convert between different data types using casting functions
Apply variable scope rules to debug code errors
Implement type checking and validation in user input programs

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to declare and initialize variables with different data types while following PEP 8 naming conventions

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create variables for your name (string), age (integer), height (float), and student status (boolean). Print each variable with descriptive labels using f-strings
Create two variables with different values, then swap their contents without creating a third temporary variable. Print both variables before and after swapping

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to perform arithmetic operations and string manipulations while handling type errors

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create variables for item prices (3 items), calculate subtotal, apply 8.5% tax, and display a formatted receipt with 2 decimal places for currency values
Take a user input string, convert it to uppercase, count the characters, and create a new string that repeats the original 3 times with dashes between

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to convert between data types safely while handling conversion errors using try-except blocks

exercises.exercise_instructions: Convert user input Celsius (string) to Fahrenheit (float) using the formula (C Ã— 9/5) + 32. Handle invalid inputs gracefully and display results with 1 decimal place
Take two string numbers from user input, convert them to integers, calculate their sum, product, and average. Display results with clear formatting

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to create and manipulate lists, tuples, and dictionaries while understanding their mutability

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create a dictionary with 5 student names as keys and list of 3 grades as values. Calculate each student's average and store in a new dictionary
Store 5 (x,y) coordinate pairs as tuples in a list. Calculate the distance from origin for each point using the Pythagorean theorem

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to predict variable behavior in different scopes and demonstrate understanding of object references

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create a global variable, modify it inside a function without using global keyword, then modify it properly. Print the variable's value and memory address at each step
Create a list, assign it to another variable, modify the original list, and observe changes. Create a true copy using slicing and repeat the experiment
